member.summary: Retrieve a filtered packet.
member.param: this struct will be filled with the contents of the filtered packet. It is owned by the caller and must be freed using av_packet_unref() when it is no longer needed. member.name: M:FFmpeg.AutoGen.ffmpeg.av_lockmgr_register(FFmpeg.AutoGen.av_lockmgr_register_cb_func)
member.summary: Register a user provided lock manager supporting the operations specified by AVLockOp. The "mutex" argument to the function points to a (void *) where the lockmgr should store/get a pointer to a user allocated mutex. It is NULL upon AV_LOCK_CREATE and equal to the value left by the last call for all other ops. If the lock manager is unable to perform the op then it should leave the mutex in the same state as when it was called and return a non-zero value. However, when called with AV_LOCK_DESTROY the mutex will always be assumed to have been successfully destroyed. If av_lockmgr_register succeeds it will return a non-negative value, if it fails it will return a negative value and destroy all mutex and unregister all callbacks. av_lockmgr_register is not thread-safe, it must be called from a single thread before any calls which make use of locking are used.
member.param: User defined callback. av_lockmgr_register invokes calls to this callback and the previously registered callback. The callback will be used to create more than one mutex each of which must be backed by its own underlying locking mechanism (i.e. do not use a single static object to implement your lock manager). If cb is set to NULL the lockmgr will be unregistered.

member.name: M:FFmpeg.AutoGen.ffmpeg.avcodec_decode_audio4(FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext*,FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame*,System.Int32*,FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacket*)
member.summary: Decode the audio frame of size avpkt->size from avpkt->data into frame.
member.param: the codec context

The AVFrame in which to store decoded audio samples. The decoder will allocate a buffer for the decoded frame by calling the AVCodecContext.get_buffer2() callback. When AVCodecContext.refcounted_frames is set to 1, the frame is reference counted and the returned reference belongs to the caller. The caller must release the frame using av_frame_unref() when the frame is no longer needed. The caller may safely write to the frame if av_frame_is_writable() returns 1. When AVCodecContext.refcounted_frames is set to 0, the returned reference belongs to the decoder and is valid only until the next call to this function or until closing or flushing the decoder. The caller may not write to it.

Zero if no frame could be decoded, otherwise it is non-zero. Note that this field being set to zero does not mean that an error has occurred. For decoders with AV_CODEC_CAP_DELAY set, no given decode call is guaranteed to produce a frame.
The input AVPacket containing the input buffer. At least avpkt->data and avpkt->size should be set. Some decoders might also require additional fields to be set.

member.name: M:FFmpeg.AutoGen.ffmpeg.avcodec_decode_subtitle2(FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext*,FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVSubtitle*,System.Int32*,FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacket*)
member.summary: Decode a subtitle message. Return a negative value on error, otherwise return the number of bytes used. If no subtitle could be decompressed, got_sub_ptr is zero. Otherwise, the subtitle is stored in *sub. Note that AV_CODEC_CAP_DR1 is not available for subtitle codecs. This is for simplicity, because the performance difference is expect to be negligible and reusing a get_buffer written for video codecs would probably perform badly due to a potentially very different allocation pattern.
member.param: the codec context
The Preallocated AVSubtitle in which the decoded subtitle will be stored, must be freed with avsubtitle_free if *got_sub_ptr is set.
Zero if no subtitle could be decompressed, otherwise, it is nonzero.
The input AVPacket containing the input buffer.

member.name: M:FFmpeg.AutoGen.ffmpeg.avcodec_decode_video2(FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext*,FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame*,System.Int32*,FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacket*)
member.summary: Decode the video frame of size avpkt->size from avpkt->data into picture. Some decoders may support multiple frames in a single AVPacket, such decoders would then just decode the first frame.
member.param: the codec context

The AVFrame in which the decoded video frame will be stored. Use av_frame_alloc() to get an AVFrame. The codec will allocate memory for the actual bitmap by calling the AVCodecContext.get_buffer2() callback. When AVCodecContext.refcounted_frames is set to 1, the frame is reference counted and the returned reference belongs to the caller. The caller must release the frame using av_frame_unref() when the frame is no longer needed. The caller may safely write to the frame if av_frame_is_writable() returns 1. When AVCodecContext.refcounted_frames is set to 0, the returned reference belongs to the decoder and is valid only until the next call to this function or until closing or flushing the decoder. The caller may not write to it.
Zero if no frame could be decompressed, otherwise, it is nonzero.

The input AVPacket containing the input buffer. You can create such packet with av_init_packet() and by then setting data and size, some decoders might in addition need other fields like flags &AV _PKT_FLAG_KEY. All decoders are designed to use the least fields possible.

member.name: M:FFmpeg.AutoGen.ffmpeg.avcodec_default_get_buffer2(FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext*,FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame*,System.Int32)
member.summary: The default callback for AVCodecContext.get_buffer2(). It is made public so it can be called by custom get_buffer2() implementations for decoders without AV_CODEC_CAP_DR1 set.

member.name: M:FFmpeg.AutoGen.ffmpeg.avcodec_encode_audio2(FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext*,FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacket*,FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame*,System.Int32*)
member.summary: Encode a frame of audio.
member.param: codec context

output AVPacket. The user can supply an output buffer by setting avpkt->data and avpkt->size prior to calling the function, but if the size of the user-provided data is not large enough, encoding will fail. If avpkt->data and avpkt->size are set, avpkt->destruct must also be set. All other AVPacket fields will be reset by the encoder using av_init_packet(). If avpkt->data is NULL, the encoder will allocate it. The encoder will set avpkt->size to the size of the output packet.

AVFrame containing the raw audio data to be encoded. May be NULL when flushing an encoder that has the AV_CODEC_CAP_DELAY capability set. If AV_CODEC_CAP_VARIABLE_FRAME_SIZE is set, then each frame can have any number of samples. If it is not set, frame->nb_samples must be equal to avctx->frame_size for all frames except the last. The final frame may be smaller than avctx->frame_size.

This field is set to 1 by libavcodec if the output packet is non-empty, and to 0 if it is empty. If the function returns an error, the packet can be assumed to be invalid, and the value of got_packet_ptr is undefined and should not be used.

member.name: M:FFmpeg.AutoGen.ffmpeg.avcodec_encode_video2(FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext*,FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacket*,FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame*,System.Int32*)
member.summary: Encode a frame of video.
member.param: codec context

output AVPacket. The user can supply an output buffer by setting avpkt->data and avpkt->size prior to calling the function, but if the size of the user-provided data is not large enough, encoding will fail. All other AVPacket fields will be reset by the encoder using av_init_packet(). If avpkt->data is NULL, the encoder will allocate it. The encoder will set avpkt->size to the size of the output packet. The returned data (if any) belongs to the caller, he is responsible for freeing it.
AVFrame containing the raw video data to be encoded. May be NULL when flushing an encoder that has the AV_CODEC_CAP_DELAY capability set.

This field is set to 1 by libavcodec if the output packet is non-empty, and to 0 if it is empty. If the function returns an error, the packet can be assumed to be invalid, and the value of got_packet_ptr is undefined and should not be used.

member.name: M:FFmpeg.AutoGen.ffmpeg.avcodec_find_best_pix_fmt_of_list(FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPixelFormat*,FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPixelFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32*)
member.summary: Find the best pixel format to convert to given a certain source pixel format. When converting from one pixel format to another, information loss may occur. For example, when converting from RGB24 to GRAY, the color information will be lost. Similarly, other losses occur when converting from some formats to other formats. avcodec_find_best_pix_fmt_of_2() searches which of the given pixel formats should be used to suffer the least amount of loss. The pixel formats from which it chooses one, are determined by the pix_fmt_list parameter.
member.param: AV_PIX_FMT_NONE terminated array of pixel formats to choose from
source pixel format
Whether the source pixel format alpha channel is used.
Combination of flags informing you what kind of losses will occur.

member.name: M:FFmpeg.AutoGen.ffmpeg.avcodec_send_frame(FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext*,FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame*)
member.summary: Supply a raw video or audio frame to the encoder. Use avcodec_receive_packet() to retrieve buffered output packets.
member.param: codec context

AVFrame containing the raw audio or video frame to be encoded. Ownership of the frame remains with the caller, and the encoder will not write to the frame. The encoder may create a reference to the frame data (or copy it if the frame is not reference-counted). It can be NULL, in which case it is considered a flush packet. This signals the end of the stream. If the encoder still has packets buffered, it will return them after this call. Once flushing mode has been entered, additional flush packets are ignored, and sending frames will return AVERROR_EOF.

member.name: M:FFmpeg.AutoGen.ffmpeg.avcodec_send_packet(FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext*,FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacket*)
member.summary: Supply raw packet data as input to a decoder.
member.param: codec context

The input AVPacket. Usually, this will be a single video frame, or several complete audio frames. Ownership of the packet remains with the caller, and the decoder will not write to the packet. The decoder may create a reference to the packet data (or copy it if the packet is not reference-counted). Unlike with older APIs, the packet is always fully consumed, and if it contains multiple frames (e.g. some audio codecs), will require you to call avcodec_receive_frame() multiple times afterwards before you can send a new packet. It can be NULL (or an AVPacket with data set to NULL and size set to 0); in this case, it is considered a flush packet, which signals the end of the stream. Sending the first flush packet will return success. Subsequent ones are unnecessary and will return AVERROR_EOF. If the decoder still has frames buffered, it will return them after sending a flush packet.

member.summary: Read packets of a media file to get stream information. This is useful for file formats with no headers such as MPEG. This function also computes the real framerate in case of MPEG-2 repeat frame mode. The logical file position is not changed by this function; examined packets may be buffered for later processing.

member.name: M:FFmpeg.AutoGen.ffmpeg.avformat_flush(FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext*)
member.summary: Discard all internally buffered data. This can be useful when dealing with discontinuities in the byte stream. Generally works only with formats that can resync. This includes headerless formats like MPEG-TS/TS but should also work with NUT, Ogg and in a limited way AVI for example.
member.param: media file handle

member.summary: Allocate and initialize an AVIOContext for buffered I/O. It must be later freed with avio_context_free().
member.param: Memory block for input/output operations via AVIOContext. The buffer must be allocated with av_malloc() and friends. It may be freed and replaced with a new buffer by libavformat. AVIOContext.buffer holds the buffer currently in use, which must be later freed with av_free().
The buffer size is very important for performance. For protocols with fixed blocksize it should be set to this blocksize. For others a typical size is a cache page, e.g. 4kb.
Set to 1 if the buffer should be writable, 0 otherwise.
An opaque pointer to user-specific data.
A function for refilling the buffer, may be NULL.
A function for writing the buffer contents, may be NULL. The function may not change the input buffers content.
A function for seeking to specified byte position, may be NULL.

member.name: M:FFmpeg.AutoGen.ffmpeg.avio_get_str(FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVIOContext*,System.Int32,System.Byte*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Read a string from pb into buf. The reading will terminate when either a NULL character was encountered, maxlen bytes have been read, or nothing more can be read from pb. The result is guaranteed to be NULL-terminated, it will be truncated if buf is too small. Note that the string is not interpreted or validated in any way, it might get truncated in the middle of a sequence for multi-byte encodings.

member.name: M:FFmpeg.AutoGen.ffmpeg.avio_get_str16le(FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVIOContext*,System.Int32,System.Byte*,System.Int32)
member.summary: Read a UTF-16 string from pb and convert it to UTF-8. The reading will terminate when either a null or invalid character was encountered or maxlen bytes have been read.

member.name: M:FFmpeg.AutoGen.ffmpeg.avio_handshake(FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVIOContext*)
member.summary: Perform one step of the protocol handshake to accept a new client. This function must be called on a client returned by avio_accept() before using it as a read/write context. It is separate from avio_accept() because it may block. A step of the handshake is defined by places where the application may decide to change the proceedings. For example, on a protocol with a request header and a reply header, each one can constitute a step because the application may use the parameters from the request to change parameters in the reply; or each individual chunk of the request can constitute a step. If the handshake is already finished, avio_handshake() does nothing and returns 0 immediately.
member.param: the client context to perform the handshake on

member.name: M:FFmpeg.AutoGen.ffmpeg.avio_seek_time(FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVIOContext*,System.Int32,System.Int64,System.Int32)
member.summary: Seek to a given timestamp relative to some component stream. Only meaningful if using a network streaming protocol (e.g. MMS.).
member.param: IO context from which to call the seek function pointers

The stream index that the timestamp is relative to. If stream_index is (-1) the timestamp should be in AV_TIME_BASE units from the beginning of the presentation. If a stream_index >= 0 is used and the protocol does not support seeking based on component streams, the call will fail.
timestamp in AVStream.time_base units or if there is no stream specified then in AV_TIME_BASE units.

Optional combination of AVSEEK_FLAG_BACKWARD, AVSEEK_FLAG_BYTE and AVSEEK_FLAG_ANY. The protocol may silently ignore AVSEEK_FLAG_BACKWARD and AVSEEK_FLAG_ANY, but AVSEEK_FLAG_BYTE will fail if used and not supported.

member.name: M:FFmpeg.AutoGen.ffmpeg.av_find_best_pix_fmt_of_2(FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPixelFormat,FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPixelFormat,FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPixelFormat,System.Int32,System.Int32*)
member.summary: Compute what kind of losses will occur when converting from one specific pixel format to another. When converting from one pixel format to another, information loss may occur. For example, when converting from RGB24 to GRAY, the color information will be lost. Similarly, other losses occur when converting from some formats to other formats. These losses can involve loss of chroma, but also loss of resolution, loss of color depth, loss due to the color space conversion, loss of the alpha bits or loss due to color quantization. av_get_fix_fmt_loss() informs you about the various types of losses which will occur when converting from one pixel format to another.
member.param: source pixel format
Whether the source pixel format alpha channel is used.

member.name: M:FFmpeg.AutoGen.ffmpeg.av_opt_set(System.Void*,System.String,System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: @{ Those functions set the field of obj with the given name to value.
member.param: A struct whose first element is a pointer to an AVClass.
the name of the field to set

The value to set. In case of av_opt_set() if the field is not of a string type, then the given string is parsed. SI postfixes and some named scalars are supported. If the field is of a numeric type, it has to be a numeric or named scalar. Behavior with more than one scalar and +- infix operators is undefined. If the field is of a flags type, it has to be a sequence of numeric scalars or named flags separated by '+' or '-'. Prefixing a flag with '+' causes it to be set without affecting the other flags; similarly, '-' unsets a flag.
flags passed to av_opt_find2. I.e. if AV_OPT_SEARCH_CHILDREN is passed here, then the option may be set on a child of obj.

the array containing the pointers to the planes of the source slice
the array containing the strides for each plane of the source image

the height of the source slice, that is the number of rows in the slice
the array containing the pointers to the planes of the destination image
the array containing the strides for each plane of the destination image

member.name: T:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecID
member.summary: Identify the syntax and semantics of the bitstream. The principle is roughly: Two decoders with the same ID can decode the same streams. Two encoders with the same ID can encode compatible streams. There may be slight deviations from the principle due to implementation details.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecID.AV_CODEC_ID_MPEG2VIDEO
member.summary: preferred ID for MPEG-1/2 video decoding

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecID.AV_CODEC_ID_FIRST_AUDIO
member.summary: A dummy id pointing at the start of audio codecs

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecID.AV_CODEC_ID_MP3
member.summary: preferred ID for decoding MPEG audio layer 1, 2 or 3

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecID.AV_CODEC_ID_GSM
member.summary: as in Berlin toast format

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecID.AV_CODEC_ID_FIRST_SUBTITLE
member.summary: A dummy ID pointing at the start of subtitle codecs.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecID.AV_CODEC_ID_TEXT
member.summary: raw UTF-8 text

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecID.AV_CODEC_ID_FIRST_UNKNOWN
member.summary: A dummy ID pointing at the start of various fake codecs.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecID.AV_CODEC_ID_SCTE_35
member.summary: Contain timestamp estimated through PCR of program stream.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecID.AV_CODEC_ID_PROBE
member.summary: codec_id is not known (like AV_CODEC_ID_NONE) but lavf should attempt to identify it

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecID.AV_CODEC_ID_MPEG2TS
member.summary: _FAKE_ codec to indicate a raw MPEG-2 TS stream (only used by libavformat)

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecID.AV_CODEC_ID_MPEG4SYSTEMS
member.summary: _FAKE_ codec to indicate a MPEG-4 Systems stream (only used by libavformat)

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecID.AV_CODEC_ID_FFMETADATA
member.summary: Dummy codec for streams containing only metadata information.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecID.AV_CODEC_ID_WRAPPED_AVFRAME
member.summary: Passthrough codec, AVFrames wrapped in AVPacket

member.name: T:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrameSideDataType
member.summary: @{ AVFrame is an abstraction for reference-counted raw multimedia data.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrameSideDataType.AV_FRAME_DATA_PANSCAN
member.summary: The data is the AVPanScan struct defined in libavcodec.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrameSideDataType.AV_FRAME_DATA_A53_CC
member.summary: ATSC A53 Part 4 Closed Captions. A53 CC bitstream is stored as uint8_t in AVFrameSideData.data. The number of bytes of CC data is AVFrameSideData.size.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrameSideDataType.AV_FRAME_DATA_STEREO3D
member.summary: Stereoscopic 3d metadata. The data is the AVStereo3D struct defined in libavutil/stereo3d.h.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrameSideDataType.AV_FRAME_DATA_MATRIXENCODING
member.summary: The data is the AVMatrixEncoding enum defined in libavutil/channel_layout.h.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrameSideDataType.AV_FRAME_DATA_DOWNMIX_INFO
member.summary: Metadata relevant to a downmix procedure. The data is the AVDownmixInfo struct defined in libavutil/downmix_info.h.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrameSideDataType.AV_FRAME_DATA_REPLAYGAIN
member.summary: ReplayGain information in the form of the AVReplayGain struct.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrameSideDataType.AV_FRAME_DATA_DISPLAYMATRIX
member.summary: This side data contains a 3x3 transformation matrix describing an affine transformation that needs to be applied to the frame for correct presentation.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrameSideDataType.AV_FRAME_DATA_AFD
member.summary: Active Format Description data consisting of a single byte as specified in ETSI TS 101 154 using AVActiveFormatDescription enum.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrameSideDataType.AV_FRAME_DATA_MOTION_VECTORS
member.summary: Motion vectors exported by some codecs (on demand through the export_mvs flag set in the libavcodec AVCodecContext flags2 option). The data is the AVMotionVector struct defined in libavutil/motion_vector.h.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrameSideDataType.AV_FRAME_DATA_SKIP_SAMPLES
member.summary: Recommmends skipping the specified number of samples. This is exported only if the "skip_manual" AVOption is set in libavcodec. This has the same format as AV_PKT_DATA_SKIP_SAMPLES.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrameSideDataType.AV_FRAME_DATA_AUDIO_SERVICE_TYPE
member.summary: This side data must be associated with an audio frame and corresponds to enum AVAudioServiceType defined in avcodec.h.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrameSideDataType.AV_FRAME_DATA_MASTERING_DISPLAY_METADATA
member.summary: Mastering display metadata associated with a video frame. The payload is an AVMasteringDisplayMetadata type and contains information about the mastering display color volume.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrameSideDataType.AV_FRAME_DATA_GOP_TIMECODE
member.summary: The GOP timecode in 25 bit timecode format. Data format is 64-bit integer. This is set on the first frame of a GOP that has a temporal reference of 0.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrameSideDataType.AV_FRAME_DATA_SPHERICAL
member.summary: The data represents the AVSphericalMapping structure defined in libavutil/spherical.h.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrameSideDataType.AV_FRAME_DATA_CONTENT_LIGHT_LEVEL
member.summary: Content light level (based on CTA-861.3). This payload contains data in the form of the AVContentLightMetadata struct.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrameSideDataType.AV_FRAME_DATA_ICC_PROFILE
member.summary: The data contains an ICC profile as an opaque octet buffer following the format described by ISO 15076-1 with an optional name defined in the metadata key entry "name".

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWFrameTransferDirection.AV_HWFRAME_TRANSFER_DIRECTION_FROM
member.summary: Transfer the data from the queried hw frame.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWFrameTransferDirection.AV_HWFRAME_TRANSFER_DIRECTION_TO
member.summary: Transfer the data to the queried hw frame.

member.name: T:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVIODataMarkerType
member.summary: Different data types that can be returned via the AVIO write_data_type callback.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVIODataMarkerType.AVIO_DATA_MARKER_HEADER
member.summary: Header data; this needs to be present for the stream to be decodeable.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVIODataMarkerType.AVIO_DATA_MARKER_SYNC_POINT
member.summary: A point in the output bytestream where a decoder can start decoding (i.e. a keyframe). A demuxer/decoder given the data flagged with AVIO_DATA_MARKER_HEADER, followed by any AVIO_DATA_MARKER_SYNC_POINT, should give decodeable results.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVIODataMarkerType.AVIO_DATA_MARKER_BOUNDARY_POINT
member.summary: A point in the output bytestream where a demuxer can start parsing (for non self synchronizing bytestream formats). That is, any non-keyframe packet start point.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVIODataMarkerType.AVIO_DATA_MARKER_UNKNOWN
member.summary: This is any, unlabelled data. It can either be a muxer not marking any positions at all, it can be an actual boundary/sync point that the muxer chooses not to mark, or a later part of a packet/fragment that is cut into multiple write callbacks due to limited IO buffer size.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVIODataMarkerType.AVIO_DATA_MARKER_TRAILER
member.summary: Trailer data, which doesn't contain actual content, but only for finalizing the output file.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVIODataMarkerType.AVIO_DATA_MARKER_FLUSH_POINT
member.summary: A point in the output bytestream where the underlying AVIOContext might flush the buffer depending on latency or buffering requirements. Typically means the end of a packet.

member.summary: Directory entry types.

member.name: T:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVOptionType
member.summary: @{ AVOptions provide a generic system to declare options on arbitrary structs ("objects"). An option can have a help text, a type and a range of possible values. Options may then be enumerated, read and written to.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVOptionType.AV_OPT_TYPE_BINARY
member.summary: offset must point to a pointer immediately followed by an int for the length

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVOptionType.AV_OPT_TYPE_IMAGE_SIZE
member.summary: offset must point to two consecutive integers

member.name: T:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType
member.summary: Types and functions for working with AVPacket. @{

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_PALETTE
member.summary: An AV_PKT_DATA_PALETTE side data packet contains exactly AVPALETTE_SIZE bytes worth of palette. This side data signals that a new palette is present.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_NEW_EXTRADATA
member.summary: The AV_PKT_DATA_NEW_EXTRADATA is used to notify the codec or the format that the extradata buffer was changed and the receiving side should act upon it appropriately. The new extradata is embedded in the side data buffer and should be immediately used for processing the current frame or packet.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_PARAM_CHANGE
member.summary: An AV_PKT_DATA_PARAM_CHANGE side data packet is laid out as follows:

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_H263_MB_INFO
member.summary: An AV_PKT_DATA_H263_MB_INFO side data packet contains a number of structures with info about macroblocks relevant to splitting the packet into smaller packets on macroblock edges (e.g. as for RFC 2190). That is, it does not necessarily contain info about all macroblocks, as long as the distance between macroblocks in the info is smaller than the target payload size. Each MB info structure is 12 bytes, and is laid out as follows:

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_REPLAYGAIN
member.summary: This side data should be associated with an audio stream and contains ReplayGain information in form of the AVReplayGain struct.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_DISPLAYMATRIX
member.summary: This side data contains a 3x3 transformation matrix describing an affine transformation that needs to be applied to the decoded video frames for correct presentation.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_STEREO3D
member.summary: This side data should be associated with a video stream and contains Stereoscopic 3D information in form of the AVStereo3D struct.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_AUDIO_SERVICE_TYPE
member.summary: This side data should be associated with an audio stream and corresponds to enum AVAudioServiceType.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_QUALITY_STATS
member.summary: This side data contains quality related information from the encoder.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_FALLBACK_TRACK
member.summary: This side data contains an integer value representing the stream index of a "fallback" track. A fallback track indicates an alternate track to use when the current track can not be decoded for some reason. e.g. no decoder available for codec.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_CPB_PROPERTIES
member.summary: This side data corresponds to the AVCPBProperties struct.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_SKIP_SAMPLES
member.summary: Recommmends skipping the specified number of samples

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_JP_DUALMONO
member.summary: An AV_PKT_DATA_JP_DUALMONO side data packet indicates that the packet may contain "dual mono" audio specific to Japanese DTV and if it is true, recommends only the selected channel to be used.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_STRINGS_METADATA
member.summary: A list of zero terminated key/value strings. There is no end marker for the list, so it is required to rely on the side data size to stop.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_SUBTITLE_POSITION
member.summary: Subtitle event position

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_MATROSKA_BLOCKADDITIONAL
member.summary: Data found in BlockAdditional element of matroska container. There is no end marker for the data, so it is required to rely on the side data size to recognize the end. 8 byte id (as found in BlockAddId) followed by data.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_WEBVTT_IDENTIFIER
member.summary: The optional first identifier line of a WebVTT cue.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_WEBVTT_SETTINGS
member.summary: The optional settings (rendering instructions) that immediately follow the timestamp specifier of a WebVTT cue.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_METADATA_UPDATE
member.summary: A list of zero terminated key/value strings. There is no end marker for the list, so it is required to rely on the side data size to stop. This side data includes updated metadata which appeared in the stream.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_MPEGTS_STREAM_ID
member.summary: MPEGTS stream ID, this is required to pass the stream ID information from the demuxer to the corresponding muxer.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_MASTERING_DISPLAY_METADATA
member.summary: Mastering display metadata (based on SMPTE-2086:2014). This metadata should be associated with a video stream and contains data in the form of the AVMasteringDisplayMetadata struct.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_SPHERICAL
member.summary: This side data should be associated with a video stream and corresponds to the AVSphericalMapping structure.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_CONTENT_LIGHT_LEVEL
member.summary: Content light level (based on CTA-861.3). This metadata should be associated with a video stream and contains data in the form of the AVContentLightMetadata struct.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_A53_CC
member.summary: ATSC A53 Part 4 Closed Captions. This metadata should be associated with a video stream. A53 CC bitstream is stored as uint8_t in AVPacketSideData.data. The number of bytes of CC data is AVPacketSideData.size.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacketSideDataType.AV_PKT_DATA_NB
member.summary: The number of side data elements (in fact a bit more than it). This is not part of the public API/ABI in the sense that it may change when new side data types are added. This must stay the last enum value. If its value becomes huge, some code using it needs to be updated as it assumes it to be smaller than other limits.

member.name: T:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVClass
member.summary: Describe the class of an AVClass context structure. That is an arbitrary struct of which the first field is a pointer to an AVClass struct (e.g. AVCodecContext, AVFormatContext etc.).

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVClass.class_name
member.summary: The name of the class; usually it is the same name as the context structure type to which the AVClass is associated.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVClass.item_name
member.summary: A pointer to a function which returns the name of a context instance ctx associated with the class.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVClass.option
member.summary: a pointer to the first option specified in the class if any or NULL

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVClass.version
member.summary: LIBAVUTIL_VERSION with which this structure was created. This is used to allow fields to be added without requiring major version bumps everywhere.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVClass.log_level_offset_offset
member.summary: Offset in the structure where log_level_offset is stored. 0 means there is no such variable

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVClass.parent_log_context_offset
member.summary: Offset in the structure where a pointer to the parent context for logging is stored. For example a decoder could pass its AVCodecContext to eval as such a parent context, which an av_log() implementation could then leverage to display the parent context. The offset can be NULL.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVClass.child_next
member.summary: Return next AVOptions-enabled child or NULL

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVClass.child_class_next
member.summary: Return an AVClass corresponding to the next potential AVOptions-enabled child.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVClass.category
member.summary: Category used for visualization (like color) This is only set if the category is equal for all objects using this class. available since version (51 << 16 | 56 << 8 | 100)

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVClass.get_category
member.summary: Callback to return the category. available since version (51 << 16 | 59 << 8 | 100)

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVClass.query_ranges
member.summary: Callback to return the supported/allowed ranges. available since version (52.12)

member.summary: pointers to the data planes/channels.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.width
member.summary: Video frames only. The coded dimensions (in pixels) of the video frame, i.e. the size of the rectangle that contains some well-defined values.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.height
member.summary: Video frames only. The coded dimensions (in pixels) of the video frame, i.e. the size of the rectangle that contains some well-defined values.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.nb_samples
member.summary: number of audio samples (per channel) described by this frame

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.format
member.summary: format of the frame, -1 if unknown or unset Values correspond to enum AVPixelFormat for video frames, enum AVSampleFormat for audio)

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.key_frame
member.summary: 1 -> keyframe, 0-> not

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.pict_type
member.summary: Picture type of the frame.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.sample_aspect_ratio
member.summary: Sample aspect ratio for the video frame, 0/1 if unknown/unspecified.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.pts
member.summary: Presentation timestamp in time_base units (time when frame should be shown to user).

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.pkt_pts
member.summary: PTS copied from the AVPacket that was decoded to produce this frame.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.pkt_dts
member.summary: DTS copied from the AVPacket that triggered returning this frame. (if frame threading isn't used) This is also the Presentation time of this AVFrame calculated from only AVPacket.dts values without pts values.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.coded_picture_number

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.display_picture_number

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.quality
member.summary: quality (between 1 (good) and FF_LAMBDA_MAX (bad))

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.opaque
member.summary: for some private data of the user

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.repeat_pict
member.summary: When decoding, this signals how much the picture must be delayed. extra_delay = repeat_pict / (2*fps)

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.interlaced_frame
member.summary: The content of the picture is interlaced.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.top_field_first
member.summary: If the content is interlaced, is top field displayed first.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.palette_has_changed
member.summary: Tell user application that palette has changed from previous frame.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.reordered_opaque
member.summary: reordered opaque 64 bits (generally an integer or a double precision float PTS but can be anything). The user sets AVCodecContext.reordered_opaque to represent the input at that time, the decoder reorders values as needed and sets AVFrame.reordered_opaque to exactly one of the values provided by the user through AVCodecContext.reordered_opaque

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.sample_rate
member.summary: Sample rate of the audio data.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.channel_layout
member.summary: Channel layout of the audio data.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.buf
member.summary: AVBuffer references backing the data for this frame. If all elements of this array are NULL, then this frame is not reference counted. This array must be filled contiguously -- if buf[i] is non-NULL then buf[j] must also be non-NULL for all j < i.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.extended_buf
member.summary: For planar audio which requires more than AV_NUM_DATA_POINTERS AVBufferRef pointers, this array will hold all the references which cannot fit into AVFrame.buf.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.nb_extended_buf
member.summary: Number of elements in extended_buf.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.flags
member.summary: Frame flags, a combination of

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.color_range
member.summary: MPEG vs JPEG YUV range. - encoding: Set by user - decoding: Set by libavcodec

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.colorspace
member.summary: YUV colorspace type. - encoding: Set by user - decoding: Set by libavcodec

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.best_effort_timestamp
member.summary: frame timestamp estimated using various heuristics, in stream time base - encoding: unused - decoding: set by libavcodec, read by user.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.pkt_pos
member.summary: reordered pos from the last AVPacket that has been input into the decoder - encoding: unused - decoding: Read by user.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.pkt_duration
member.summary: duration of the corresponding packet, expressed in AVStream->time_base units, 0 if unknown. - encoding: unused - decoding: Read by user.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.metadata
member.summary: metadata. - encoding: Set by user. - decoding: Set by libavcodec.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.decode_error_flags
member.summary: decode error flags of the frame, set to a combination of FF_DECODE_ERROR_xxx flags if the decoder produced a frame, but there were errors during the decoding. - encoding: unused - decoding: set by libavcodec, read by user.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.channels
member.summary: number of audio channels, only used for audio. - encoding: unused - decoding: Read by user.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.pkt_size
member.summary: size of the corresponding packet containing the compressed frame. It is set to a negative value if unknown. - encoding: unused - decoding: set by libavcodec, read by user.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.qscale_table
member.summary: QP table

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.qstride
member.summary: QP store stride

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.hw_frames_ctx

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.opaque_ref
member.summary: AVBufferRef for free use by the API user. FFmpeg will never check the contents of the buffer ref. FFmpeg calls av_buffer_unref() on it when the frame is unreferenced. av_frame_copy_props() calls create a new reference with av_buffer_ref() for the target frame's opaque_ref field.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFrame.crop_top
member.summary: cropping Video frames only. The number of pixels to discard from the the top/bottom/left/right border of the frame to obtain the sub-rectangle of the frame intended for presentation. @{

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVOptionRange.value_max
member.summary: Value range. For string ranges this represents the min/max length. For dimensions this represents the min/max pixel count or width/height in multi-component case.

member.summary: Range flag. If set to 1 the struct encodes a range, if set to 0 a single value.

member.name: T:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVOption_default_val
member.summary: the default value for scalar options

member.name: T:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPixFmtDescriptor
member.summary: Descriptor that unambiguously describes how the bits of a pixel are stored in the up to 4 data planes of an image. It also stores the subsampling factors and number of components.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPixFmtDescriptor.nb_components
member.summary: The number of components each pixel has, (1-4)

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPixFmtDescriptor.log2_chroma_w
member.summary: Amount to shift the luma width right to find the chroma width. For YV12 this is 1 for example. chroma_width = AV_CEIL_RSHIFT(luma_width, log2_chroma_w) The note above is needed to ensure rounding up. This value only refers to the chroma components.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPixFmtDescriptor.log2_chroma_h
member.summary: Amount to shift the luma height right to find the chroma height. For YV12 this is 1 for example. chroma_height= AV_CEIL_RSHIFT(luma_height, log2_chroma_h) The note above is needed to ensure rounding up. This value only refers to the chroma components.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPixFmtDescriptor.flags
member.summary: Combination of AV_PIX_FMT_FLAG_... flags.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPixFmtDescriptor.comp
member.summary: Parameters that describe how pixels are packed. If the format has 1 or 2 components, then luma is 0. If the format has 3 or 4 components: if the RGB flag is set then 0 is red, 1 is green and 2 is blue; otherwise 0 is luma, 1 is chroma-U and 2 is chroma-V.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPixFmtDescriptor.alias
member.summary: Alternative comma-separated names.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVComponentDescriptor.plane
member.summary: Which of the 4 planes contains the component.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVComponentDescriptor.step
member.summary: Number of elements between 2 horizontally consecutive pixels. Elements are bits for bitstream formats, bytes otherwise.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVComponentDescriptor.offset
member.summary: Number of elements before the component of the first pixel. Elements are bits for bitstream formats, bytes otherwise.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVComponentDescriptor.shift
member.summary: Number of least significant bits that must be shifted away to get the value.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVComponentDescriptor.depth
member.summary: Number of bits in the component.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVComponentDescriptor.step_minus1

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVComponentDescriptor.depth_minus1
member.summary: deprecated, use depth instead

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVComponentDescriptor.offset_plus1

member.name: T:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWDeviceContext
member.summary: This struct aggregates all the (hardware/vendor-specific) "high-level" state, i.e. state that is not tied to a concrete processing configuration. E.g., in an API that supports hardware-accelerated encoding and decoding, this struct will (if possible) wrap the state that is common to both encoding and decoding and from which specific instances of encoders or decoders can be derived.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWDeviceContext.av_class
member.summary: A class for logging. Set by av_hwdevice_ctx_alloc().

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWDeviceContext.internal
member.summary: Private data used internally by libavutil. Must not be accessed in any way by the caller.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWDeviceContext.type
member.summary: This field identifies the underlying API used for hardware access.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWDeviceContext.hwctx

member.summary: This field may be set by the caller before calling av_hwdevice_ctx_init().

member.name: T:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWFramesContext
member.summary: This struct describes a set or pool of "hardware" frames (i.e. those with data not located in normal system memory). All the frames in the pool are assumed to be allocated in the same way and interchangeable.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWFramesContext.av_class
member.summary: A class for logging.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWFramesContext.internal
member.summary: Private data used internally by libavutil. Must not be accessed in any way by the caller.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWFramesContext.device_ref
member.summary: A reference to the parent AVHWDeviceContext. This reference is owned and managed by the enclosing AVHWFramesContext, but the caller may derive additional references from it.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWFramesContext.device_ctx
member.summary: The parent AVHWDeviceContext. This is simply a pointer to device_ref->data provided for convenience.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWFramesContext.hwctx
member.summary: The format-specific data, allocated and freed automatically along with this context.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWFramesContext.free
member.summary: This field may be set by the caller before calling av_hwframe_ctx_init().

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWFramesContext.user_opaque
member.summary: Arbitrary user data, to be used e.g. by the free() callback.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWFramesContext.pool
member.summary: A pool from which the frames are allocated by av_hwframe_get_buffer(). This field may be set by the caller before calling av_hwframe_ctx_init(). The buffers returned by calling av_buffer_pool_get() on this pool must have the properties described in the documentation in the corresponding hw type's header (hwcontext_*.h). The pool will be freed strictly before this struct's free() callback is invoked.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWFramesContext.initial_pool_size
member.summary: Initial size of the frame pool. If a device type does not support dynamically resizing the pool, then this is also the maximum pool size.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWFramesContext.format
member.summary: The pixel format identifying the underlying HW surface type.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWFramesContext.sw_format

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWFramesContext.width
member.summary: The allocated dimensions of the frames in this pool.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWFramesContext.height
member.summary: The allocated dimensions of the frames in this pool.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWFramesConstraints.valid_hw_formats

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWFramesConstraints.min_width
member.summary: The minimum size of frames in this hw_frames_ctx. (Zero if not known.)

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVHWFramesConstraints.max_width
member.summary: The maximum size of frames in this hw_frames_ctx. (INT_MAX if not known / no limit.)

member.summary: Callbacks for locking. They protect accesses to device_context and video_context calls. They also protect access to the internal staging texture (for av_hwframe_transfer_data() calls). They do NOT protect access to hwcontext or decoder state in general.

member.name: T:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCPBProperties

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCPBProperties.max_bitrate
member.summary: Maximum bitrate of the stream, in bits per second. Zero if unknown or unspecified.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCPBProperties.min_bitrate
member.summary: Minimum bitrate of the stream, in bits per second. Zero if unknown or unspecified.

member.summary: Average bitrate of the stream, in bits per second. Zero if unknown or unspecified.

member.summary: The size of the buffer to which the ratecontrol is applied, in bits. Zero if unknown or unspecified.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCPBProperties.vbv_delay
member.summary: The delay between the time the packet this structure is associated with is received and the time when it should be decoded, in periods of a 27MHz clock.

member.name: T:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacket
member.summary: This structure stores compressed data. It is typically exported by demuxers and then passed as input to decoders, or received as output from encoders and then passed to muxers.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacket.buf
member.summary: A reference to the reference-counted buffer where the packet data is stored. May be NULL, then the packet data is not reference-counted.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacket.pts
member.summary: Presentation timestamp in AVStream->time_base units; the time at which the decompressed packet will be presented to the user. Can be AV_NOPTS_VALUE if it is not stored in the file. pts MUST be larger or equal to dts as presentation cannot happen before decompression, unless one wants to view hex dumps. Some formats misuse the terms dts and pts/cts to mean something different. Such timestamps must be converted to true pts/dts before they are stored in AVPacket.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacket.dts
member.summary: Decompression timestamp in AVStream->time_base units; the time at which the packet is decompressed. Can be AV_NOPTS_VALUE if it is not stored in the file.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacket.flags
member.summary: A combination of AV_PKT_FLAG values

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacket.side_data
member.summary: Additional packet data that can be provided by the container. Packet can contain several types of side information.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacket.duration
member.summary: Duration of this packet in AVStream->time_base units, 0 if unknown. Equals next_pts - this_pts in presentation order.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVPacket.pos
member.summary: byte position in stream, -1 if unknown

member.name: T:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext
member.summary: main external API structure. New fields can be added to the end with minor version bumps. Removal, reordering and changes to existing fields require a major version bump. You can use AVOptions (av_opt* / av_set/get*()) to access these fields from user applications. The name string for AVOptions options matches the associated command line parameter name and can be found in libavcodec/options_table.h The AVOption/command line parameter names differ in some cases from the C structure field names for historic reasons or brevity. sizeof(AVCodecContext) must not be used outside libav*.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.av_class
member.summary: information on struct for av_log - set by avcodec_alloc_context3

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.codec_tag
member.summary: fourcc (LSB first, so "ABCD" -> ('D'<<24) + ('C'<<16) + ('B'<<8) + 'A'). This is used to work around some encoder bugs. A demuxer should set this to what is stored in the field used to identify the codec. If there are multiple such fields in a container then the demuxer should choose the one which maximizes the information about the used codec. If the codec tag field in a container is larger than 32 bits then the demuxer should remap the longer ID to 32 bits with a table or other structure. Alternatively a new extra_codec_tag + size could be added but for this a clear advantage must be demonstrated first. - encoding: Set by user, if not then the default based on codec_id will be used. - decoding: Set by user, will be converted to uppercase by libavcodec during init.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.internal
member.summary: Private context used for internal data.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.opaque
member.summary: Private data of the user, can be used to carry app specific stuff. - encoding: Set by user. - decoding: Set by user.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.bit_rate
member.summary: the average bitrate - encoding: Set by user; unused for constant quantizer encoding. - decoding: Set by user, may be overwritten by libavcodec if this info is available in the stream

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.bit_rate_tolerance
member.summary: number of bits the bitstream is allowed to diverge from the reference. the reference can be CBR (for CBR pass1) or VBR (for pass2) - encoding: Set by user; unused for constant quantizer encoding. - decoding: unused

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.global_quality
member.summary: Global quality for codecs which cannot change it per frame. This should be proportional to MPEG-1/2/4 qscale. - encoding: Set by user. - decoding: unused

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.compression_level
member.summary: - encoding: Set by user. - decoding: unused

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.flags
member.summary: AV_CODEC_FLAG_*. - encoding: Set by user. - decoding: Set by user.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.flags2
member.summary: AV_CODEC_FLAG2_* - encoding: Set by user. - decoding: Set by user.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.extradata
member.summary: some codecs need / can use extradata like Huffman tables. MJPEG: Huffman tables rv10: additional flags MPEG-4: global headers (they can be in the bitstream or here) The allocated memory should be AV_INPUT_BUFFER_PADDING_SIZE bytes larger than extradata_size to avoid problems if it is read with the bitstream reader. The bytewise contents of extradata must not depend on the architecture or CPU endianness. - encoding: Set/allocated/freed by libavcodec. - decoding: Set/allocated/freed by user.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.time_base
member.summary: This is the fundamental unit of time (in seconds) in terms of which frame timestamps are represented. For fixed-fps content, timebase should be 1/framerate and timestamp increments should be identically 1. This often, but not always is the inverse of the frame rate or field rate for video. 1/time_base is not the average frame rate if the frame rate is not constant.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.ticks_per_frame
member.summary: For some codecs, the time base is closer to the field rate than the frame rate. Most notably, H.264 and MPEG-2 specify time_base as half of frame duration if no telecine is used ...

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.delay
member.summary: Codec delay.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.width
member.summary: picture width / height.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.height
member.summary: picture width / height.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.coded_width
member.summary: Bitstream width / height, may be different from width/height e.g. when the decoded frame is cropped before being output or lowres is enabled.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.coded_height
member.summary: Bitstream width / height, may be different from width/height e.g. when the decoded frame is cropped before being output or lowres is enabled.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.gop_size
member.summary: the number of pictures in a group of pictures, or 0 for intra_only - encoding: Set by user. - decoding: unused

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.pix_fmt
member.summary: Pixel format, see AV_PIX_FMT_xxx. May be set by the demuxer if known from headers. May be overridden by the decoder if it knows better.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.me_method
member.summary: This option does nothing

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.draw_horiz_band
member.summary: If non NULL, 'draw_horiz_band' is called by the libavcodec decoder to draw a horizontal band. It improves cache usage. Not all codecs can do that. You must check the codec capabilities beforehand. When multithreading is used, it may be called from multiple threads at the same time; threads might draw different parts of the same AVFrame, or multiple AVFrames, and there is no guarantee that slices will be drawn in order. The function is also used by hardware acceleration APIs. It is called at least once during frame decoding to pass the data needed for hardware render. In that mode instead of pixel data, AVFrame points to a structure specific to the acceleration API. The application reads the structure and can change some fields to indicate progress or mark state. - encoding: unused - decoding: Set by user.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.get_format
member.summary: callback to negotiate the pixelFormat

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.max_b_frames
member.summary: maximum number of B-frames between non-B-frames Note: The output will be delayed by max_b_frames+1 relative to the input. - encoding: Set by user. - decoding: unused

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.b_quant_factor
member.summary: qscale factor between IP and B-frames If > 0 then the last P-frame quantizer will be used (q= lastp_q*factor+offset). If < 0 then normal ratecontrol will be done (q= -normal_q*factor+offset). - encoding: Set by user. - decoding: unused

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.b_quant_offset
member.summary: qscale offset between IP and B-frames - encoding: Set by user. - decoding: unused

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.has_b_frames
member.summary: Size of the frame reordering buffer in the decoder. For MPEG-2 it is 1 IPB or 0 low delay IP. - encoding: Set by libavcodec. - decoding: Set by libavcodec.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.i_quant_factor
member.summary: qscale factor between P- and I-frames If > 0 then the last P-frame quantizer will be used (q = lastp_q * factor + offset). If < 0 then normal ratecontrol will be done (q= -normal_q*factor+offset). - encoding: Set by user. - decoding: unused

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.i_quant_offset
member.summary: qscale offset between P and I-frames - encoding: Set by user. - decoding: unused

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.temporal_cplx_masking

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.get_buffer2
member.summary: This callback is called at the beginning of each frame to get data buffer(s) for it. There may be one contiguous buffer for all the data or there may be a buffer per each data plane or anything in between. What this means is, you may set however many entries in buf[] you feel necessary. Each buffer must be reference-counted using the AVBuffer API (see description of buf[] below).

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.refcounted_frames
member.summary: If non-zero, the decoded audio and video frames returned from avcodec_decode_video2() and avcodec_decode_audio4() are reference-counted and are valid indefinitely. The caller must free them with av_frame_unref() when they are not needed anymore. Otherwise, the decoded frames must not be freed by the caller and are only valid until the next decode call.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.strict_std_compliance
member.summary: strictly follow the standard (MPEG-4, ...). - encoding: Set by user. - decoding: Set by user. Setting this to STRICT or higher means the encoder and decoder will generally do stupid things, whereas setting it to unofficial or lower will mean the encoder might produce output that is not supported by all spec-compliant decoders. Decoders don't differentiate between normal, unofficial and experimental (that is, they always try to decode things when they can) unless they are explicitly asked to behave stupidly (=strictly conform to the specs)

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.execute2
member.summary: The codec may call this to execute several independent things. It will return only after finishing all tasks. The user may replace this with some multithreaded implementation, the default implementation will execute the parts serially. Also see avcodec_thread_init and e.g. the --enable-pthread configure option.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecContext.skip_alpha
member.summary: Skip processing alpha if supported by codec. Note that if the format uses pre-multiplied alpha (common with VP6, and recommended due to better video quality/compression) the image will look as if alpha-blended onto a black background. However for formats that do not use pre-multiplied alpha there might be serious artefacts (though e.g. libswscale currently assumes pre-multiplied alpha anyway).

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodec.send_frame
member.summary: Encode API with decoupled packet/frame dataflow. The API is the same as the avcodec_ prefixed APIs (avcodec_send_frame() etc.), except that: - never called if the codec is closed or the wrong type, - if AV_CODEC_CAP_DELAY is not set, drain frames are never sent, - only one drain frame is ever passed down,

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodec.receive_frame
member.summary: Decode API with decoupled packet/frame dataflow. This function is called to get one output frame. It should call ff_decode_get_packet() to obtain input data.

member.name: T:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters
member.summary: This struct describes the properties of an encoded stream.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters.codec_type
member.summary: General type of the encoded data.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters.codec_id
member.summary: Specific type of the encoded data (the codec used).

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters.codec_tag
member.summary: Additional information about the codec (corresponds to the AVI FOURCC).

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters.extradata
member.summary: Extra binary data needed for initializing the decoder, codec-dependent.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters.extradata_size
member.summary: Size of the extradata content in bytes.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters.format
member.summary: - video: the pixel format, the value corresponds to enum AVPixelFormat. - audio: the sample format, the value corresponds to enum AVSampleFormat.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters.bit_rate
member.summary: The average bitrate of the encoded data (in bits per second).

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters.bits_per_coded_sample
member.summary: The number of bits per sample in the codedwords.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters.bits_per_raw_sample
member.summary: This is the number of valid bits in each output sample. If the sample format has more bits, the least significant bits are additional padding bits, which are always 0. Use right shifts to reduce the sample to its actual size. For example, audio formats with 24 bit samples will have bits_per_raw_sample set to 24, and format set to AV_SAMPLE_FMT_S32. To get the original sample use "(int32_t)sample >> 8"."

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters.profile
member.summary: Codec-specific bitstream restrictions that the stream conforms to.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters.width
member.summary: Video only. The dimensions of the video frame in pixels.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters.sample_aspect_ratio
member.summary: Video only. The aspect ratio (width / height) which a single pixel should have when displayed.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters.field_order
member.summary: Video only. The order of the fields in interlaced video.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters.color_range
member.summary: Video only. Additional colorspace characteristics.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters.video_delay
member.summary: Video only. Number of delayed frames.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters.channel_layout
member.summary: Audio only. The channel layout bitmask. May be 0 if the channel layout is unknown or unspecified, otherwise the number of bits set must be equal to the channels field.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters.channels
member.summary: Audio only. The number of audio channels.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters.sample_rate
member.summary: Audio only. The number of audio samples per second.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters.block_align
member.summary: Audio only. The number of bytes per coded audio frame, required by some formats.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters.frame_size
member.summary: Audio only. Audio frame size, if known. Required by some formats to be static.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters.initial_padding
member.summary: Audio only. The amount of padding (in samples) inserted by the encoder at the beginning of the audio. I.e. this number of leading decoded samples must be discarded by the caller to get the original audio without leading padding.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters.trailing_padding
member.summary: Audio only. The amount of padding (in samples) appended by the encoder to the end of the audio. I.e. this number of decoded samples must be discarded by the caller from the end of the stream to get the original audio without any trailing padding.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParameters.seek_preroll
member.summary: Audio only. Number of samples to skip after a discontinuity.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParserContext.repeat_pict
member.summary: This field is used for proper frame duration computation in lavf. It signals, how much longer the frame duration of the current frame is compared to normal frame duration.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParserContext.offset
member.summary: byte offset from starting packet start

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParserContext.key_frame
member.summary: Set by parser to 1 for key frames and 0 for non-key frames. It is initialized to -1, so if the parser doesn't set this flag, old-style fallback using AV_PICTURE_TYPE_I picture type as key frames will be used.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParserContext.dts_sync_point
member.summary: Synchronization point for start of timestamp generation.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParserContext.dts_ref_dts_delta
member.summary: Offset of the current timestamp against last timestamp sync point in units of AVCodecContext.time_base.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParserContext.pts_dts_delta
member.summary: Presentation delay of current frame in units of AVCodecContext.time_base.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParserContext.cur_frame_pos
member.summary: Position of the packet in file.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParserContext.pos
member.summary: Byte position of currently parsed frame in stream.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParserContext.last_pos
member.summary: Previous frame byte position.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParserContext.duration
member.summary: Duration of the current frame. For audio, this is in units of 1 / AVCodecContext.sample_rate. For all other types, this is in units of AVCodecContext.time_base.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParserContext.picture_structure
member.summary: Indicate whether a picture is coded as a frame, top field or bottom field.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParserContext.output_picture_number
member.summary: Picture number incremented in presentation or output order. This field may be reinitialized at the first picture of a new sequence.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParserContext.width
member.summary: Dimensions of the decoded video intended for presentation.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParserContext.coded_width
member.summary: Dimensions of the coded video.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVCodecParserContext.format
member.summary: The format of the coded data, corresponds to enum AVPixelFormat for video and for enum AVSampleFormat for audio.

member.summary: The timebase used for the timestamps of the input packets. Set by the caller before av_bsf_init().

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVBSFContext.time_base_out
member.summary: The timebase used for the timestamps of the output packets. Set by the filter in av_bsf_init().

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVBitStreamFilter.codec_ids
member.summary: A list of codec ids supported by the filter, terminated by AV_CODEC_ID_NONE. May be NULL, in that case the bitstream filter works with any codec id.

member.summary: A class for the private data, used to declare bitstream filter private AVOptions. This field is NULL for bitstream filters that do not declare any options.

member.summary: Buffer must have AVPROBE_PADDING_SIZE of extra allocated bytes filled with zero.

member.summary: Size of buf except extra allocated bytes

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVIndexEntry.timestamp
member.summary: Timestamp in AVStream.time_base units, preferably the time from which on correctly decoded frames are available when seeking to this entry. That means preferable PTS on keyframe based formats. But demuxers can choose to store a different timestamp, if it is more convenient for the implementation or nothing better is known

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVIndexEntry.flags2_size30
member.summary: Flag is used to indicate which frame should be discarded after decoding.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVIndexEntry.min_distance
member.summary: Minimum distance between this and the previous keyframe, used to avoid unneeded searching.

member.name: T:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream
member.summary: Stream structure. New fields can be added to the end with minor version bumps. Removal, reordering and changes to existing fields require a major version bump. sizeof(AVStream) must not be used outside libav*.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.index
member.summary: stream index in AVFormatContext

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.id
member.summary: Format-specific stream ID. decoding: set by libavformat encoding: set by the user, replaced by libavformat if left unset

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.time_base
member.summary: This is the fundamental unit of time (in seconds) in terms of which frame timestamps are represented.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.start_time
member.summary: Decoding: pts of the first frame of the stream in presentation order, in stream time base. Only set this if you are absolutely 100% sure that the value you set it to really is the pts of the first frame. This may be undefined (AV_NOPTS_VALUE).

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.duration
member.summary: Decoding: duration of the stream, in stream time base. If a source file does not specify a duration, but does specify a bitrate, this value will be estimated from bitrate and file size.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.nb_frames
member.summary: number of frames in this stream if known or 0

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.disposition
member.summary: AV_DISPOSITION_* bit field

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.discard
member.summary: Selects which packets can be discarded at will and do not need to be demuxed.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.sample_aspect_ratio
member.summary: sample aspect ratio (0 if unknown) - encoding: Set by user. - decoding: Set by libavformat.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.avg_frame_rate
member.summary: Average framerate

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.attached_pic
member.summary: For streams with AV_DISPOSITION_ATTACHED_PIC disposition, this packet will contain the attached picture.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.side_data
member.summary: An array of side data that applies to the whole stream (i.e. the container does not allow it to change between packets).

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.nb_side_data
member.summary: The number of elements in the AVStream.side_data array.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.event_flags
member.summary: Flags for the user to detect events happening on the stream. Flags must be cleared by the user once the event has been handled. A combination of AVSTREAM_EVENT_FLAG_*.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.pts_wrap_bits
member.summary: number of bits in pts (used for wrapping control)

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.first_dts
member.summary: Timestamp corresponding to the last dts sync point.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.probe_packets
member.summary: Number of packets to buffer for codec probing

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.codec_info_nb_frames
member.summary: Number of frames that have been demuxed during avformat_find_stream_info()

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.last_in_packet_buffer
member.summary: last packet in packet_buffer for this stream when muxing.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.index_entries
member.summary: Only used if the format does not support seeking natively.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.r_frame_rate
member.summary: Real base framerate of the stream. This is the lowest framerate with which all timestamps can be represented accurately (it is the least common multiple of all framerates in the stream). Note, this value is just a guess! For example, if the time base is 1/90000 and all frames have either approximately 3600 or 1800 timer ticks, then r_frame_rate will be 50/1.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.stream_identifier
member.summary: Stream Identifier This is the MPEG-TS stream identifier +1 0 means unknown

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.request_probe
member.summary: stream probing state -1 -> probing finished 0 -> no probing requested rest -> perform probing with request_probe being the minimum score to accept. NOT PART OF PUBLIC API

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.skip_to_keyframe
member.summary: Indicates that everything up to the next keyframe should be discarded.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.skip_samples
member.summary: Number of samples to skip at the start of the frame decoded from the next packet.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.start_skip_samples
member.summary: If not 0, the number of samples that should be skipped from the start of the stream (the samples are removed from packets with pts==0, which also assumes negative timestamps do not happen). Intended for use with formats such as mp3 with ad-hoc gapless audio support.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.first_discard_sample
member.summary: If not 0, the first audio sample that should be discarded from the stream. This is broken by design (needs global sample count), but can't be avoided for broken by design formats such as mp3 with ad-hoc gapless audio support.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.last_discard_sample
member.summary: The sample after last sample that is intended to be discarded after first_discard_sample. Works on frame boundaries only. Used to prevent early EOF if the gapless info is broken (considered concatenated mp3s).

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.nb_decoded_frames
member.summary: Number of internally decoded frames, used internally in libavformat, do not access its lifetime differs from info which is why it is not in that structure.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.mux_ts_offset
member.summary: Timestamp offset added to timestamps before muxing NOT PART OF PUBLIC API

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.pts_wrap_reference
member.summary: Internal data to check for wrapping of the time stamp

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.pts_wrap_behavior
member.summary: Options for behavior, when a wrap is detected.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.update_initial_durations_done
member.summary: Internal data to prevent doing update_initial_durations() twice

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.pts_reorder_error
member.summary: Internal data to generate dts from pts

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.last_dts_for_order_check
member.summary: Internal data to analyze DTS and detect faulty mpeg streams

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.inject_global_side_data
member.summary: Internal data to inject global side data

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.recommended_encoder_configuration
member.summary: String containing paris of key and values describing recommended encoder configuration. Paris are separated by ','. Keys are separated from values by '='.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.display_aspect_ratio
member.summary: display aspect ratio (0 if unknown) - encoding: unused - decoding: Set by libavformat to calculate sample_aspect_ratio internally

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVStream.internal
member.summary: An opaque field for libavformat internal usage. Must not be accessed in any way by callers.
