member.summary: Format I/O context. New fields can be added to the end with minor version bumps. Removal, reordering and changes to existing fields require a major version bump. sizeof(AVFormatContext) must not be used outside libav*, use avformat_alloc_context() to create an AVFormatContext.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.av_class
member.summary: A class for logging and Exports (de)muxer private options if they exist.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.iformat
member.summary: The input container format.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.oformat
member.summary: The output container format.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.priv_data
member.summary: Format private data. This is an AVOptions-enabled struct if and only if iformat/oformat.priv_class is not NULL.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.pb
member.summary: I/O context.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.ctx_flags
member.summary: Flags signalling stream properties. A combination of AVFMTCTX_*. Set by libavformat.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.nb_streams
member.summary: Number of elements in AVFormatContext.streams.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.streams
member.summary: A list of all streams in the file. New streams are created with avformat_new_stream().

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.filename
member.summary: input or output filename

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.start_time
member.summary: Position of the first frame of the component, in AV_TIME_BASE fractional seconds. NEVER set this value directly: It is deduced from the AVStream values.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.duration
member.summary: Duration of the stream, in AV_TIME_BASE fractional seconds. Only set this value if you know none of the individual stream durations and also do not set any of them. This is deduced from the AVStream values if not set.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.bit_rate
member.summary: Total stream bitrate in bit/s, 0 if not available. Never set it directly if the file_size and the duration are known as FFmpeg can compute it automatically.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.flags
member.summary: Flags modifying the (de)muxer behaviour. A combination of AVFMT_FLAG_*. Set by the user before avformat_open_input() / avformat_write_header().

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.probesize
member.summary: Maximum size of the data read from input for determining the input container format. Demuxing only, set by the caller before avformat_open_input().

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.max_analyze_duration
member.summary: Maximum duration (in AV_TIME_BASE units) of the data read from input in avformat_find_stream_info(). Demuxing only, set by the caller before avformat_find_stream_info(). Can be set to 0 to let avformat choose using a heuristic.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.video_codec_id
member.summary: Forced video codec_id. Demuxing: Set by user.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.audio_codec_id
member.summary: Forced audio codec_id. Demuxing: Set by user.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.subtitle_codec_id
member.summary: Forced subtitle codec_id. Demuxing: Set by user.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.max_index_size
member.summary: Maximum amount of memory in bytes to use for the index of each stream. If the index exceeds this size, entries will be discarded as needed to maintain a smaller size. This can lead to slower or less accurate seeking (depends on demuxer). Demuxers for which a full in-memory index is mandatory will ignore this. - muxing: unused - demuxing: set by user

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.max_picture_buffer
member.summary: Maximum amount of memory in bytes to use for buffering frames obtained from realtime capture devices.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.nb_chapters
member.summary: Number of chapters in AVChapter array. When muxing, chapters are normally written in the file header, so nb_chapters should normally be initialized before write_header is called. Some muxers (e.g. mov and mkv) can also write chapters in the trailer. To write chapters in the trailer, nb_chapters must be zero when write_header is called and non-zero when write_trailer is called. - muxing: set by user - demuxing: set by libavformat

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.metadata
member.summary: Metadata that applies to the whole file.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.start_time_realtime
member.summary: Start time of the stream in real world time, in microseconds since the Unix epoch (00:00 1st January 1970). That is, pts=0 in the stream was captured at this real world time. - muxing: Set by the caller before avformat_write_header(). If set to either 0 or AV_NOPTS_VALUE, then the current wall-time will be used. - demuxing: Set by libavformat. AV_NOPTS_VALUE if unknown. Note that the value may become known after some number of frames have been received.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.fps_probe_size
member.summary: The number of frames used for determining the framerate in avformat_find_stream_info(). Demuxing only, set by the caller before avformat_find_stream_info().

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.error_recognition
member.summary: Error recognition; higher values will detect more errors but may misdetect some more or less valid parts as errors. Demuxing only, set by the caller before avformat_open_input().

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.interrupt_callback
member.summary: Custom interrupt callbacks for the I/O layer.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.debug
member.summary: Flags to enable debugging.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.max_interleave_delta
member.summary: Maximum buffering duration for interleaving.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.strict_std_compliance
member.summary: Allow non-standard and experimental extension

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.event_flags
member.summary: Flags for the user to detect events happening on the file. Flags must be cleared by the user once the event has been handled. A combination of AVFMT_EVENT_FLAG_*.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.max_ts_probe
member.summary: Maximum number of packets to read while waiting for the first timestamp. Decoding only.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.avoid_negative_ts
member.summary: Avoid negative timestamps during muxing. Any value of the AVFMT_AVOID_NEG_TS_* constants. Note, this only works when using av_interleaved_write_frame. (interleave_packet_per_dts is in use) - muxing: Set by user - demuxing: unused

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.ts_id
member.summary: Transport stream id. This will be moved into demuxer private options. Thus no API/ABI compatibility

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.audio_preload
member.summary: Audio preload in microseconds. Note, not all formats support this and unpredictable things may happen if it is used when not supported. - encoding: Set by user - decoding: unused

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.max_chunk_duration
member.summary: Max chunk time in microseconds. Note, not all formats support this and unpredictable things may happen if it is used when not supported. - encoding: Set by user - decoding: unused

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.max_chunk_size
member.summary: Max chunk size in bytes Note, not all formats support this and unpredictable things may happen if it is used when not supported. - encoding: Set by user - decoding: unused

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.use_wallclock_as_timestamps
member.summary: forces the use of wallclock timestamps as pts/dts of packets This has undefined results in the presence of B frames. - encoding: unused - decoding: Set by user

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.avio_flags
member.summary: avio flags, used to force AVIO_FLAG_DIRECT. - encoding: unused - decoding: Set by user

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.duration_estimation_method
member.summary: The duration field can be estimated through various ways, and this field can be used to know how the duration was estimated. - encoding: unused - decoding: Read by user

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.skip_initial_bytes
member.summary: Skip initial bytes when opening stream - encoding: unused - decoding: Set by user

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.correct_ts_overflow
member.summary: Correct single timestamp overflows - encoding: unused - decoding: Set by user

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.seek2any
member.summary: Force seeking to any (also non key) frames. - encoding: unused - decoding: Set by user

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.flush_packets
member.summary: Flush the I/O context after each packet. - encoding: Set by user - decoding: unused

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.probe_score
member.summary: format probing score. The maximal score is AVPROBE_SCORE_MAX, its set when the demuxer probes the format. - encoding: unused - decoding: set by avformat, read by user

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.format_probesize
member.summary: number of bytes to read maximally to identify format. - encoding: unused - decoding: set by user

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.codec_whitelist
member.summary: ',' separated list of allowed decoders. If NULL then all are allowed - encoding: unused - decoding: set by user

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.format_whitelist
member.summary: ',' separated list of allowed demuxers. If NULL then all are allowed - encoding: unused - decoding: set by user

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.internal
member.summary: An opaque field for libavformat internal usage. Must not be accessed in any way by callers.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.io_repositioned
member.summary: IO repositioned flag. This is set by avformat when the underlaying IO context read pointer is repositioned, for example when doing byte based seeking. Demuxers can use the flag to detect such changes.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.video_codec
member.summary: Forced video codec. This allows forcing a specific decoder, even when there are multiple with the same codec_id. Demuxing: Set by user

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.audio_codec
member.summary: Forced audio codec. This allows forcing a specific decoder, even when there are multiple with the same codec_id. Demuxing: Set by user

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.subtitle_codec
member.summary: Forced subtitle codec. This allows forcing a specific decoder, even when there are multiple with the same codec_id. Demuxing: Set by user

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.data_codec
member.summary: Forced data codec. This allows forcing a specific decoder, even when there are multiple with the same codec_id. Demuxing: Set by user

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.metadata_header_padding
member.summary: Number of bytes to be written as padding in a metadata header. Demuxing: Unused. Muxing: Set by user via av_format_set_metadata_header_padding.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.opaque
member.summary: User data. This is a place for some private data of the user.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.control_message_cb
member.summary: Callback used by devices to communicate with application.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.output_ts_offset
member.summary: Output timestamp offset, in microseconds. Muxing: set by user

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.dump_separator
member.summary: dump format separator. can be ", " or " " or anything else - muxing: Set by user. - demuxing: Set by user.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.data_codec_id
member.summary: Forced Data codec_id. Demuxing: Set by user.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.open_cb
member.summary: Called to open further IO contexts when needed for demuxing.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFormatContext.protocol_whitelist

member.summary: A comma separated list of short names for the format. New names may be appended with a minor bump.

member.summary: Descriptive name for the format, meant to be more human-readable than name. You should use the NULL_IF_CONFIG_SMALL() macro to define it.

member.summary: Can use flags: AVFMT_NOFILE, AVFMT_NEEDNUMBER, AVFMT_SHOW_IDS, AVFMT_GENERIC_INDEX, AVFMT_TS_DISCONT, AVFMT_NOBINSEARCH, AVFMT_NOGENSEARCH, AVFMT_NO_BYTE_SEEK, AVFMT_SEEK_TO_PTS.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVInputFormat.extensions
member.summary: If extensions are defined, then no probe is done. You should usually not use extension format guessing because it is not reliable enough

member.summary: AVClass for the private context

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVInputFormat.mime_type
member.summary: Comma-separated list of mime types. It is used check for matching mime types while probing.

They may not be used outside of libavformat and can be changed and removed at will. New public fields should be added right above. ****************************************************************

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVInputFormat.raw_codec_id
member.summary: Raw demuxers store their codec ID here.

member.summary: Size of private data so that it can be allocated in the wrapper.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVInputFormat.read_probe
member.summary: Tell if a given file has a chance of being parsed as this format. The buffer provided is guaranteed to be AVPROBE_PADDING_SIZE bytes big so you do not have to check for that unless you need more.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVInputFormat.read_header
member.summary: Read the format header and initialize the AVFormatContext structure. Return 0 if OK. 'avformat_new_stream' should be called to create new streams.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVInputFormat.read_packet
member.summary: Read one packet and put it in 'pkt'. pts and flags are also set. 'avformat_new_stream' can be called only if the flag AVFMTCTX_NOHEADER is used and only in the calling thread (not in a background thread).

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVInputFormat.read_close
member.summary: Close the stream. The AVFormatContext and AVStreams are not freed by this function

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVInputFormat.read_seek
member.summary: Seek to a given timestamp relative to the frames in stream component stream_index.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVInputFormat.read_timestamp
member.summary: Get the next timestamp in stream[stream_index].time_base units.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVInputFormat.read_play
member.summary: Start/resume playing - only meaningful if using a network-based format (RTSP).

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVInputFormat.read_pause
member.summary: Pause playing - only meaningful if using a network-based format (RTSP).

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVInputFormat.read_seek2
member.summary: Seek to timestamp ts. Seeking will be done so that the point from which all active streams can be presented successfully will be closest to ts and within min/max_ts. Active streams are all streams that have AVStream.discard < AVDISCARD_ALL.

member.summary: Pause or resume playback for network streaming protocols - e.g. MMS.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVIOContext.direct
member.summary: avio_read and avio_write should if possible be satisfied directly instead of going through a buffer, and avio_seek will always call the underlying seek function directly.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVIOContext.bytes_read
member.summary: Bytes read statistic This field is internal to libavformat and access from outside is not allowed.

member.name: T:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFilterLink
member.summary: A link between two filters. This contains pointers to the source and destination filters between which this link exists, and the indexes of the pads involved. In addition, this link also contains the parameters which have been negotiated and agreed upon between the filter, such as image dimensions, format, etc.

member.summary: Define the time base used by the PTS of the frames/samples which will pass through this link. During the configuration stage, each filter is supposed to change only the output timebase, while the timebase of the input link is assumed to be an unchangeable property.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFilterLink.request_samples
member.summary: Audio only, the destination filter sets this to a non-zero value to request that buffers with the given number of samples should be sent to it. AVFilterPad.needs_fifo must also be set on the corresponding input pad. Last buffer before EOF will be padded with silence.

member.summary: Graph the filter belongs to.

member.summary: Current timestamp of the link, as defined by the most recent frame(s), in link time_base units.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFilterLink.current_pts_us
member.summary: Current timestamp of the link, as defined by the most recent frame(s), in AV_TIME_BASE units.

member.summary: Index in the age array.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFilterLink.frame_rate
member.summary: Frame rate of the stream on the link, or 1/0 if unknown or variable; if left to 0/0, will be automatically copied from the first input of the source filter if it exists.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFilterLink.partial_buf
member.summary: Buffer partially filled with samples to achieve a fixed/minimum size.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFilterLink.partial_buf_size
member.summary: Size of the partial buffer to allocate. Must be between min_samples and max_samples.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFilterLink.min_samples
member.summary: Minimum number of samples to filter at once. If filter_frame() is called with fewer samples, it will accumulate them in partial_buf. This field and the related ones must not be changed after filtering has started. If 0, all related fields are ignored.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFilterLink.max_samples
member.summary: Maximum number of samples to filter at once. If filter_frame() is called with more samples, it will split them.

member.summary: Number of channels.

member.summary: Link processing flags.

member.summary: Number of past frames sent through the link.

member.name: F:FFmpeg.AutoGen.AVFilterLink.frame_wanted_out
member.summary: True if a frame is currently wanted on the output of this filter. Set when ff_request_frame() is called by the output, cleared when a frame is filtered.

member.summary: Attempts to load a native library using platform nammig convention.
member.param: Path of the library.
Name of the library.
Version of the library.
member.returns: A handle to the library when found; otherwise, .
member.remarks: This function may return a null handle. If it does, individual functions loaded from it will throw a DllNotFoundException, but not until an attempt is made to actually use the function (rather than load it). This matches how PInvokes behave.

member.name: M:FFmpeg.AutoGen.Native.WindowsNativeMethods.LoadLibrary(System.String)
member.summary: Loads the specified module into the address space of the calling process. The specified module may cause other modules to be loaded.

param.name: dllToLoad
param.para: The name of the module. This can be either a library module (a .dll file) or an executable module (an .exe file). The name specified is the file name of the module and is not related to the name stored in the library module itself, as specified by the LIBRARY keyword in the module-definition (.def) file.
If the string specifies a full path, the function searches only that path for the module.
If the string specifies a relative path or a module name without a path, the function uses a standard search strategy to find the module; for more information, see the Remarks.

If the function cannot find the module, the function fails. When specifying a path, be sure to use backslashes (\), not forward slashes (/). For more information about paths, see Naming a File or Directory.

If the string specifies a module name without a path and the file name extension is omitted, the function appends the default library extension .dll to the module name. To prevent the function from appending .dll to the module name, include a trailing point character (.) in the module name string.

member.returns: If the function succeeds, the return value is a handle to the module. If the function fails, the return value is . To get extended error information, call .
